snippet: Olivia Putman of Studio Andrée Putman in Paris introduces a line of lighting created in collaboration with Lalique.
abstract: Paris-based furniture designer Olivia Putman introduces an 11-piece lamp collection created in collaboration with Lalique. Photo (S)
lead_paragraph: Olivia Putman has been busy since taking over as head of Studio Andrée Putman, her well-known mother's Paris-based business, five years ago. Ms. Putman, 47, has designed furniture for Fermob, Emeco and Serralunga as well as the Le Rivage hotel in Hong Kong. And last week, she was in town to introduce a line of lighting created in collaboration with Lalique. The 11-piece Collection Orgue includes sconces, chandeliers and pendant lamps as well as desk, table and floor lamps that all incorporate satin-finished faceted crystal cylinders, which ''recall old forms and old shapes, like what René Lalique designed for the ship the Normandie in the 1930s,'' Ms. Putman said. Prices range from $1,900 for a chrome lamp (minus the lampshade) to $130,500 for a large gilded chandelier (the medium size, in chrome, is $95,000).
